# UD Yoruba YTB

Language: [Yoruba](../yo/overview/yo-hub.html) (code: `yo`)<br/>
Family: Niger-Congo, Defoid

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v2.2 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Adédayọ̀ Olúòkun, Daniel Zeman, Seyi Williams.

Repository: [UD_Yoruba-YTB](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Yoruba-YTB)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udyo_ytb)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: bible

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Yoruba-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Yoruba-YTB/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [zeman&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;ufal&nbsp;•&nbsp;mff&nbsp;•&nbsp;cuni&nbsp;•&nbsp;cz].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

| UPOS | annotated manually, natively in UD style |

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 100 sentences and 2688 tokens.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 473 tokens (18%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: -ní, kìn-ín, òru.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 16 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>INTJ</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>VERB</a>, <a>X</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: SYM</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 3 word types tagged as particles (PART): kì, kò, mo</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 40 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): a, ara, i, mi, mo, mí, ohun, rẹ, rẹ̀, ti, tirẹ̀, tiwọn, tèmi, tí, u, un, wa, wá, wọn, wọ́n, yín, Òun, àwa, àwọn, á, èmi, èwo, èyí, èéṣe, ìwọ, í, ó, ú, ún, ẹ, ẹni, ẹnìkan, ẹ̀yin, ọ, ọ́</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 5 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): gbogbo, náà, wọ̀nyí, yìí, àwọn</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 1 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: àwọn</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 20 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): baà, bá, jẹ́, kí, le, lè, má, máa, ni, ní, se, sí, ti, tíì, wà, yóò, í, ń, ṣe, ṣeé</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 9 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: jẹ́, lè, máa, ní, sí, wà, yóò, ń, ṣe</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not use the VerbForm feature.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 11 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: ni, wà, jẹ́, ní, ., mi, rẹ̀, sí, yóò, ń, ṣe.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 21 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: ń, kí, ni, ti, yóò, jẹ́, lè, máa, í, ṣe, bá, má, ,, baà, se, le, nì, sí, tíì, ìbá, ṣeé.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 2 relation subtypes: <a>compound:prt</a>, <a>compound:svc</a></li>
<li>The following 8 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>vocative</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>appos</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>fixed</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>reparandum</a>, <a>dep</a></li>
